lead_paragraph: The wisdom of the British Government in resisting demands for a detailed and specific statement of its war aims is being justified by events. It is impossible to make a blueprint of the post-war world when no man knows which nations will be friends or foes, or, for that matter, what kind of Europe will be left when the last gun has been fired and the last bomb dropped.
abstract: Ed on impossibility of Brit war aims statement because of shifting situation
